runs.comm: cracking start. Width on offer and Rohit crunches that one bounce into the point boundary. Couldn't have asked for a better ball first up
this one's a half-volley on the pads, picked away superbly into the gap between midwicket and mid-on
floats it full, hint of movement away from off, he gets forward and defends it to cover
opens the face of the bat slightly and runs it down to third man
driven through the line, straight to cover
gets back into the crease and bunts it to point
squared up a touch as the ball nips away from the length area on middle, played down to third man, not entirely convincing though
wristy flick. Fetches it from middle and bisects the two midwicket fielders, the slow outfield means there's enough time for the boundary rider at square leg to get around
flies off the blade, delicately dabs it past the diving point fielder
back of length delivery on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
whipped away off his hip to deep square

that's a Dhawan special. Hit me delivery. Too full on the pads, and he unfurls a delightful flick that soars over deep midwicket. Sanath Jayasuriya written all over that stroke. The Sri Lankan legend would have surely nodded in appreciation.
pushed through quicker on middle, turned wide of midwicket
looks to force that past cover point, hit straight to the fielder
drifting into middle, he gets forward and defends. There was an appeal, very close call according to the replay. The ball hit the pad first and then the bat. Dhawan is a touch lucky
walks across and sweeps it with the angle over deep backward square. Not much turn on that and it found the sweet spot of the bat as it sailed way over the ropes
punched to wide long-off for an easy single, sensible stuff
almost like a seamer, gets it full on middle, flicked wide of square leg, they jog for a single
too full and boom! Hammered over mid-off, one bounce into the boundary. What difference two nights can make. Was unplayable in Pune, has been given a harsh welcome here in Ranchi
slower one on middle and leg, flicked towards the man running in from deep square leg
bunted to the point fielder
length ball but plenty of width on offer, Dhawan smacks him on the up over cover. Ball's sliding onto the bat nicely and he pinged that off the middle
full toss outside off, he simply extends his arms and places it into the gap between cover and point. He'll put those away even if you wake him up in the middle of his sleep
too easy. This one's too full again and right in the slot for the drive, Dhawan gets his bat down nicely and crashes that into the gap wide of the mid-off fielder
turned wide of the bowler towards the man coming in from long-on
slow turn, drifting into middle and leg, tucked to the short midwicket region
pitches on middle and goes straight on, eased to midwicket
on the shorter side and Dhawan has picked him into the gap at deep backward square. Got into position early and pulled him without much fuss
gets across and fetches the sweep from outside off, once again peppers the deep square leg area. No one there, once he got it up and over the infield, it was headed only one way. Powerfully struck
gets back and punches it to cover
tucked wide of square leg
slower one but well down leg, Dhawan steps out and looks to sweep that up and over short fine, swung early
defended towards cover, looked up, made quick eye contact and off they went. Excellent
dabbed towards third man
takes it on the full and plays it down the ground, mid-off fielder slides across and kicks it further away to give away an extra run
slower delivery, too short and well down leg, Dhawan is way too early into the pull and misses it, on the second bounce to Chandimal
that is a crunching cover drive! Doesn't need an invitation to play the ball there. Too full and wide, nice high elbow as ball met bat and bang
whipped into the gap at deep square leg. Was nothing more than a gentle push, but the ball kept gaining momentum as it passed the infield
short ball on off, gets on top of the bounce and dabs it to third man
uses the width on offer to crunch that behind point, third man does well to slide around to stop that. Maiden T20I fifty for Dhawan
sharp bouncer on off, Dhawan looks to sway out of the way but ends up dabbing it late to point where Dilshan misfields to give away a single
slower one outside off, angled down to third man
appeal for lbw, this one cuts back into middle and leg, Dhawan is hit on the pad as he pushes outside the line, was saved by a thin inside edge

and there's the breakthrough. This one was dug in short at good pace, Dhawan looked to help it over the keeper's head but was cramped for room as the ball got the glove on the way through to Chandimal who accepted it gleefully
works it down to long-on
punched towards deep midwicket, Rahane wanted the second, Rohit wasn't keen
wrists it wide of midwicket
driven with the spin to wide long-off
punched to long-off, too short and he was nicely behind the line
looks to ease it wide of point, can't pick the gap. Good over
cracking delivery. Drifts back in, grips the surface and turns away sharply from middle, beats Rohit's outside edge by not much
whipped into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
played back down the pitch, once again nicely tossed up on middle, turns away
beaten as he looks to turn it, the ball was angling in and would have missed leg, the ball deflects off the pad to short third man
pulled away, excellent dive by the Gunathikala at wide long-on but couldn't get to the ball. It was short, and Rahane got into position nice and early before putting that away
gets a thick inside edge and tolls down the pitch
slow turn from middle, played back past the bowler
worked across the line towards deep square
looks to cut, cramped for room, ends up mistiming it to the fielder, but Rahane is lightning quick, Rohit manages to get across in the nick of time too
not much bounce on that one, short one on middle, pulled to deep midwicket
steps out and realises it wasn't in his zone to loft, tucks it to short fine leg
makes room and bunts it down to long-off, good work by Thisara
looks to cut, cramped for room, chopped back towards the keeper
nudged towards square leg
backs away and squeezes it down to third man, Chandimal tries to take the throw one-handed but doesn't take it cleanly, and the batsmen are well aware as they pinch the second
on the pads, flicked straight to deep square, a metre on either side and it was four
banged in short, well directed outside off, Rahane sways out of the way, but umpire Anil Chaudhary thinks it was well over his head. Poor call though, Rahane was well down the pitch
backs away to hit over cover, ends up mistiming to mid-off
into the blockhole, toe ends that one to mid-off but they pinch a run to bring up the 100
width on offer, crashed towards deep cover
on the shorter side, makes a bit of room and slaps it to deep cover again
drifting into middle and leg, worked towards long-on
steps out to loft but can't get to the pitch, mistimed to long on
looks to go inside-out over cover point, can't get bat to it. Missed the line of the ball
muscled over deep midwicket. 20 rows back at least. This was a release shot, one that was brewing for a while. His eyes hit up as he was that bowled halfway down the pitch, swung through cleanly
Rahane skips out, this is speared wide outside off. Rahane reaches out, but can't touch it
dug in short on middle, perhaps Rahane is trying too much. He plays an agricultural swipe to long-on
controlled hitting from Rohit at the other end. Shorter and outside off, he gets on top of the bounce, rolls his wrists, and pulls to deep midwicket
Rahane has timed the pants off this! Nothing agricultural about this. Full and in the slot outside off, Rahane drills it over mid-off, one-bounce four

sloppy work from Rajitha at short third man. Short and just a shade outside off, Rahane rides the bounce, and steers it to the man at 45. Rajitha moves to his left, but timed his slide badly/ was too lazy to slide. He did not even get his body behind it
short on middle and leg, turned around the corner

outstanding catch, much-needed wicket that for Sri Lanka. Slower delivery that was bowled fuller on off, Rohit looks to turn it but is early into the stroke, ball lobs in the air as Chameera dives full length across the pitch to take that. The best part was the control as his elbows landed on the hard turf. Rohit goes just when he was looking to rev up the engine
hops across and whips it away towards midwicket
flicked towards deep midwicket
banged in short, looks to target his ribs but gets the radar wrong, well down leg
slower one on middle, tucked to short midwicket
looks to get across the line and pull, but is beaten for pace
backs away to hit over cover, gets a thick inside edge towards deep square instead
steps out but can't get the room to hit it over cover, bunts it to the fielder
too early into the pull, the ball skids onto him, takes the top edge and lobs straight to Dilshan at cover point. As easy as they come
gets forward and drives it back to the bowler
eased wide of point for a quick single
worked wide of midwicket, excellent running between the wickets, Raina was into the second run even before Pandya turned around
on the pads, worked to square leg
slower delivery on off, swiped across the line into the midwicket boundary. Picked the ball out of the hand nice and early, made clean connection
low full toss outside off, inside-edges it down to long on
too full but well down leg, Raina looks to walk across and hoick it over deep square, misses
steps out and bunts the full toss to cover
helicopter drive, can you call it? Full outside off, squeezed into the gap at deep extra cover

swings north, ball goes south. Looked to loft it over long-on, ball flew off the thick outside edge to third man, excellent work by Gunathilaka, diving full length to his left, clean pick up and throw as well
hits the gap, you knew it was four the moment it hit the bat. Too full, enough width, he positions himself well and hammers that over the infield and into the deep cover boundary
too short and that's been deposited deep into the deep midwicket stands. Gets into position quickly and muscles miles
in the slot, clean swing and the long-on fielder was just a spectator. Anything in that arc and he'll just go for it. No half measures there. Clean ball striking this
full toss on the pads, swung away to deep midwicket
clever stuff, bunts it wide of cover and gives Pandya the strike
right into the blockhole, jams his bat down in time to squeeze that out, rolls behind the keeper but they scamper through for a single
steps out and punches it wide of cover to keep strike
walks across the stumps, picks the length early and helps him over short fine leg, one bounce into the boundary. Clever batting

this one's been belted into the deep midwicket boundary. The fielder there wasn't too far from the ball but it was a fierce hit, one bounce into the boundary again. Waiting deep inside the crease and lofting it cleanly over the infield
backs away to go over cover but he floats it full and way outside off, work for the umpire

hasn't timed it well enough but will still get a boundary. Slightly cramped for room as he looks to whip that over midwicket, Kapugedara puts in the hard yards in getting towards the ball but pushes it over
looks to squeeze it behind square, plays inside the line, good full delivery
gets a thick edge that flies past the wicketkeeper and into the third man boundary
into the blockhole, digs it out over the bowler's head
low full toss on middle, swung away to deep midwicket, Raina wanted the second, Pandya put his hand out and said no
sees the batsman lining him up and bowls it full and around the wide line, they scamper across for a bye, excellent match awareness
toe-ends a slog to long-on, Raina wanted the second, Pandya wasn't having any of it
slower ball outside off, he walks across and then plays a half-sweep towards deep midwicket. He intended to angle it down to third man initially. Would have been called wide had he let that go
another full ball, another wide. Seventh or eight stump line that. Immense pressure on the bowler
attempted yorker, turned out to be a low full toss, he swung through the line but only managed to get the toe end of the bat, long on fielder takes it easily. End of a superb cameo
walks across the stumps and scoops that full toss straight to backward square leg.

that's a hat-trick for Thisara! You can't blame Yuvraj for that, looks to go down town but the low full toss meets the toe end of the bat, Senanayake takes an easy catch at long-on. Fourth hat-trick in T20I history
flat bats one to long-off
Chandimal puts down a tough chance, it was full, he jammed his bat down to squeeze it away, flew off the edge even as Chandi was leaping to his right like a goal-keeper
it was a length ball outside off, Dhoni had a wild swing at that one, missed it by a long way
squeezed back over the bowler's head, in between long-off and long-on, would have been surprised if Dhoni wouldn't have completed the second
walks across the stumps and mows it towards deep midwicket, they get an extra run off the deflection at the bowler's endd

gets a thick inside edge into the fine leg boundary. Streaky, on another day it may have crashed into leg stump, but it doesn't matter. Dhoni's bat came down at an angle, couldn't generate power as a result. No one at fine leg
